beast…into the valley. The valley represents a place where beasts find water and grass, the sustenance they need. In the same way, the Lord makes all his children to "lie down in green pastures" (Ps. 23:2).

Spirit of the Lord caused him to rest. The Lord gave ancient Israel rest from bondage, rest from care, peace of heart, and peace of conscience, which are gifts of the Spirit. So will he also do for all his children, in any age.

make thyself a glorious name. This statement is spoken in the same sense as the phrase "make himself an everlasting name" in 63:12. Through the Lord's mercy, goodness, and power, he has established his reputation as a God of such qualities forever.
